title: Dynamic Queue Shananigans
body:
As much of the player database already know, Riot is implementing _Dynamic Queue_ into League of Legends for season 6. Although it is an okay idea to get casual players involved in ranked, it is at the cost of several things. These things include Rank Value, Player Enjoyment and changes to competitive play. And League of Legends will fall off because of all these negative points that come from dynamic queue. 

Lets start at rank value, many players are very happy with their ranks at the moment. And a lot of players work hard to achieve their desired border. But with the implementation of dynamic queue, these ranks will become increasingly worthless due to the rise of player elo. Take heroes of the storm as an example, another MOBA very similar to league. It was released with dynamic queue, and very quickly the top rank (rank 1) became worthless as every player just queued with their friends. This will cause many people to leave league of legends because their current league will not have the same value. 

Player Enjoyment is perhaps the most important part of a game. But with the implementation of dynamic queue, players will not be enjoying themselves. Particularly when there is a dynamic team of 4. Because there will always be one stranger. Now, particularly in League of Legends, where the community is renowned for being very salty it is noticable that salty players are often seen in packs of other salty players. And especially for the other person, it will not be enjoyable to play. Especially if you _Clicked the button for SoloQ_. This will cause players to leave because they will not find the game fun anymore.

Lastly, this movement will have a huge impact on competitive play, because the majority of the playerbase are competitive. And ranked is a place where people are meant to be competitive, so making it more casual just doesnt make sense. One of the big reasons WoW doesnt have as many players as it used to is that it balanced the game for the casual gamers. And WoW just fell apart, Riot as a company has particularly not payed attention to the fate of other games whilst they implemented Dynamic queue.

For these reasons, i strongly recommend Riot think over the idea to implement dynamic queue into the game. Especially just as the season starts. Because in my strong opinion, it will make the game fall apart. The game wouldnt be here right now if it had not evolved, but this step is a step backward.

~Crispy

Well spoken, pal. Honestly though every games goal is to be accessible to casual and newer players whilst still satisfying veteran players. Dynamic queue is a way for people to eliminate the variables making them lose @ solo queue, ie. bad teammates etc.    If they were to recreate matchmaking algorithms to only allow 5 man parties to vs other 5's, 4's vs 4's etc it might work, however, this would make queue times pretty shocking.. 
On another note, people are complaining about how Dynamic Queue would misrepresent ELO -- it's not as if the current system is all that accurate. And one may only queue with people of similar rank, so in that respect it's okay ---- smurfs boosting is not going to get any worse with this system, it's already about as easy as it can be. 
I feel like maybe Riot is trying too hard to become accessible to new/casual players and are forgetting what the experienced players want. However, as you said, the game does need to and will evolve, and I like the idea of Dynamic Queue I just really don't think it'll be that practical. 
Regardless, not a chance Riot will hold back from it, even with all the complaints on forums etc. 

P.S.    - I read the official post about Dynamic Queue - and I couldn't find anything regarding this; does Dynamic Queue match up with players on solo/duo queue?
